17.summary: Back in November 2014, there were quite limited options to getting around, we took a long-distance coach from Kunming [昆明] to Yuanmou [元谋] and stayed the night at Xinhua Village [新华乡] that is closest to the earth forest. There is really nothing much to do around here except taking a walk around the nearby village, […]
17.title: Langbapu Earth Forest [浪巴铺土林] – the beginning of everything

75.summary: Chuxiong [楚雄] was an impromptu stop along the way before we made our way to Dali [大理] and we had the most unexpected experiences… It is the simplest of town with not many tourists and we spent the day doing what the locals do. We enjoyed watching the Yi people, dressed in their traditional costumes, […]
75.title: Chuxiong [楚雄]

110.summary: Duration: about 1 hour View from the train window: we probably went from 1,500m to 1,900m above sea-level without feeling much difference in the train. The sky was so blue and the fields were lined with crops.
110.title: Train Journey: Chuxiong [楚雄] to Dali [大理]

128.summary: The cafe owners in the ancient town work extremely hard over the various Chinese public holidays because that’s when most Chinese people travel to Dali. With all the income made from these peak seasons, it is enough to cover costs for the entire year. And that’s enough for them, anything extra is a bonus. It […]
128.title: Dali Ancient Town [大理古镇]

162.summary: It is impossible to mention Erhai [洱海] without first emphasising that Cangshan [苍山] is a long stretch of snow-capped mountain parallel to it. With 19 peaks and elevation between 3,500m to 4,000m above sea-level, Cangshan [苍山] is quite impossible for an average human to conquer. Most often, travellers would resort to taking aerial tram rides […]
162.title: The inseparable Cangshan Erhai [苍山洱海]

192.summary: Xizhou [喜洲] – literally Happy [喜] Continent [洲] in Chinese – is a little town in Dali [大理] located on the west of Erhai [洱海] and 29km away from Dali Ancient Town [大理古镇]. In her heyday, it served as an important trading post along the Chama Gudao [茶马古道] – literally Tea [茶] Horse [马] Ancient […]
192.title: Xizhou [喜洲] – our happy place

246.summary: Yunnan [云南] – literally Cloud [云] South [南] in Chinese – is a region in western China with the most spectacular terrains. At an average of 2,000m above sea level, locals believe that this is the closest anyone could get to the skies. It is good to know the elevation of these major places before planning a trip so […]
246.title: Yunnan [云南]

272.summary: I always imagined I first trip would be touching down in Beijing and checking out The Great Wall. Instead I found myself extremely bored in Hong Kong (a week there is far too long) and taking a day tour (I hate tours) to China to Guangzhou. It wasn’t as glamorous as my travels with Linzy in […]
272.title: I went to Mainland China from Hong Kong and all I got was a photo of myself on a panda plate

276.summary: The Cameron Highlands is a beautiful land of tea plantations.  I will however remember the Cameron Highlands and Tanah Rata where I stayed for the Jungle Trek 2 Incident. Now, if you ever go to the Cameron Highlands beware “jungle trek 2”. We were told it was an easy hike to take with stunning scenery and […]
276.title: The Jungle Trek 2 Incident

422.summary: I was alone in Bandar Seri Begawan (BSB) in Brunei. How would I survive? BSB is the capital of the country, and I rarely saw anyone outside. It was like walking through a small town/kampong in the UK. I was also here alone, and BSB and Brunei, are not really popular destinations on the South […]
422.title: How to be alone in Babdar Seri Bagawan, Brunei

431.summary: 10 hours from Topcider [Топчидер] in Serbia [Србија] to Podgorica [Подгорица] in Montenegro [Црна Гора] – passing through 254 tunnels and 435 bridges… we thought we would get bored at some point but we stayed glued to the window and went “wha! whaa!! whaaa!!! whaaaa!!!! whaaaaa!!!!! whaaaaaa!!!!!! WHA! WHAA!! WHAAA!!! WHAAAA!!!! – louder with each […]
431.title: Serbia to Montenegro Train Journey

457.summary: I visited Penang in Chinese New Year. In the temples the longest incense sticks I’ve ever seen in my life burned. In the temples everything that could be burnt was burnt. My friend and I hired a moped and drove around the island. At dinner we stumbled across my first (of soon to be many) […]
457.title: How to drive a Rickshaw in Penang

582.summary: Phu Quoc – pronounced as Foo Coo·wok – literally means Rich [Phú] Nation [Quốc] in Vietnamese as well as in Chinese [富国]. It is the largest island off the southwestern tip of Vietnam. Since March 2014, all foreigners could visit with a 30-days visa-free period. Although there is an airport on the island, most international […]
582.title: Phu Quoc is the new Bali

637.summary: We were highly intoxicated bythe juxtapositions of different cultures, the textured and weathered surfaces,the untold stories of unexpected spacesand the never-ending randomness… At the end of our trip, we were so energised – mostly powered by our own imaginations – and even when our flight got delayed, we found some last-minute amusement at the airport. […]
637.title: The buildings of Ho Chi Minh City

657.summary: Jetlagged, I tell Linzy I need a coffee. She takes me to what used to be an abattoir – an interesting place called 1933 Old Millfun. Now it’s  a trendy mall. The only cafe appears to have dogs – some kind of puppy cafe. I notice one of the dogs is actually  a pig and […]
657.title: Surprising Shanghai – drinks in books and pigs in cafes

688.summary: Cesky Krumlov was my first introduction to Czech Republic after taking a 2 hour shuttle-bus from the train station of Linz. One day I will take my very own Linz with me. It is a lovely little town with a castle next to a river and it’s not Prague! As a result it has very […]
688.title: River and beer in Cesky Krumlov

696.summary: Every birthday I try to celebrate in a new location and in 2008, it was Tokyo. The nice lady at the check-in desk of Virgin Atlantic noticed my birthday was during the flight and with a wink wink nudge nudge let me go with the exciting advice to “mention there is a note on the […]
696.title: Tokyo: Get electrocuted to cure jet lag and a birthday hangover

702.summary: Kuching has possibly the most cat statues per square mile of any place on Earth. In fact, a trip to Kuching could easily be spent trying to catch them all as if they were Pokemon and you were trying to fill your Pokedex. Kuching means cat in Malay. As a result the city has the […]
702.title: Kuching is a real life Pokemon adventure

707.summary: The Brno Astronomical Clock is a huge contrast to the Prague Astronomical Clock and might even seem ridiculous to many. It is a rather sleek looking monument with a digital clock that spins 360° around the top – showing time by the hour – a feature that people usually miss because they are too focused […]
707.title: If you have an hour in Brno, it had better be around 11am

767.summary: For adults, a single day pass in Prague costs 110Kč ($4.80 Usd) – seniors get 50% off*. I was ready to purchase 1 Adult and 2 Senior passes at the train station when the chirpy guy in the ticketing booth took a closer look at my folks. “Hmm… are they above 65?”“Yes.”“Good! I suggest that […]
767.title: Why you should travel to Prague at 65!

826.summary: During Apollo 11 landing 50 years ago, the tape-recorded piece of music that the Moon heard from mankind is affectionately called the New World Symphony. Otherwise known as the Symphony No.9 in E minor, this is a classical piece of music written by Czech composer, Antonin Dvorak. Dvorak might not be one of the Top 10 […]
826.title: The man behind the music that went to the Moon and back

896.summary: For the Tintin fans out there, if the train journey from Sebia to Montenegro had made you feel like you are in the title sequence of the TV series, getting around Montnegro will make you believe that you have arrived at Syldavia – the fictitious country that Hergé had created in King Ottokar’s Sceptre and […]
896.title: Walk into Tintin’s Syldavia in Montenegro

939.summary: Meow: When you enter Kotor Old Town by the main gate (also known as the Sea Gate), you would notice a slogan of the former Yugoslavia that is often attributed to Josip Broz Tito – “What belongs to others we don’t want, (what is) ours we don’t give (up)”. Montenegro only gained independence in 2006. […]
939.title: Sshhh… listen to what the cats of Kotor have to say…

1013.summary: Jetlagged, I tell Linzy I need a coffee. She takes me to what used to be an abattoir – an interesting place called 1933 Old Millfun. Now it’s  a trendy mall. The only cafe appears to have dogs – some kind of puppy cafe. I notice one of the dogs is actually  a pig and […]
1013.title: Surprising Shanghai – drinks in books and pigs in cafes

1019.summary: Hydra / Idra [ Ύδρα ] is a carfree Greek island in the Aegean Sea that is accesible by ferry from various ferry terminals – 1 to 2 hours ride from Pireas [ Πειραιάς ] and 20 to 30 minutes ride from Ermioni [ Ερμιόνη ] / Poros [ Πόρος ]. We flew from Montenegro […]
1019.title: Hydra-te your mind with the Greek way of life

1029.summary: I visited Penang in Chinese New Year (CNY). Chinese New Year is the festival that gathers relatives together, dead and alive. A family portrait is usually a typical ritual of such events. In the temples the longest incense sticks I’ve ever seen in my life burned. In the temples everything that could be burnt was […]
1029.title: How to drive a Rickshaw in Penang

1040.summary: It is impossible to mention Erhai [洱海] without first emphasising that Cangshan [苍山] is a long stretch of snow-capped mountain parallel to it. With 19 peaks and elevation between 3,500m to 4,000m above sea-level, Cangshan [苍山] is quite impossible for an average human to conquer. Most often, travellers would resort to taking aerial tram rides […]
1040.title: The inseparable Cangshan Erhai [苍山洱海]

1067.summary: In Serbian, Belgrade [Београд] literally means White [Бео] City [град]. It is the capital of Serbia [Србија], located on the confluence of two rivers – Sava [Сава] that flows from Slovenia and Danube that originates from Germany. ArkaBarka – literally Ark Barge in Serbian – was a good change of scenery from our european home […]
1067.title: Floating on the Danube in Belgrade

1071.summary: We went straight from the Nikola Tesla Airport to the Nikola Tesla Boulevard with a ride app called Bolt (former Taxify) -it was the most convenient means of transport except during the peak hours in the city. We were dropped on the side of the boulevard as there were no through roads and had to […]
1071.title: In search of Nikola Tesla in Belgrade

1073.summary: Apart from the Nikola Tesla Museum, the only other thing I heard about Belgrade before arriving was the remains of NATO-bombed buildings. Nothing much has been done. A friend of friend Personally, I think a lot has been done. At least, the thought process of keeping them around. These buildings could easily have been torn […]
1073.title: Moving on from the bombed-buildings of Belgrade

1078.summary: The Brno Astronomical Clock is a huge contrast to the Prague Astronomical Clock and might even seem ridiculous to many. To begin with, it does not look like a clock. Many think along the line of “gigantic bullet” or “some phallic object” but it reminded me of the huge menhir that Obelix carrys on his […]
1078.title: If you have an hour in Brno, it had better be around 11am

1229.summary: If you have more than 8 hours in Tokyo, it is totally worth getting out of the airport! Haneda Airport is closer to the city but sometimes, flights arrive at Narita Airport and passengers have to make their connection to Haneda (with their suitcases) even though it is under the same airline! First thing first, […]
1229.title: A layover in Tokyo could change your lives (and eyes) forever

1266.summary: Jon and I were married in Las Vegas – at the drive-through of the Little White Chapel that Britney Spears once got married. It was just the two of us and the Lyft driver who drove us to the chapel. Most people think we hadn’t thought about throwing a proper wedding. What they do not […]
1266.title: Where in the world to get married?

1269.summary: Back in 2015, Jon had an average of a mere 5-Likes per post. On a random November day, 88 more of his friends took a second glance at this picture and liked it. In his mum’s words, he had “gone viral”. We were in a long-distance relationship at that time – he was based in […]
1269.title: My then-boyfriend was #Japanese #bunny king

1372.summary: Back in school, we learnt that temperature drops 6°C every 1,000m and a metre is about three feet. Manitou Springs is at an elevation of 6,412ft and Pike Peak’s elevation is 14,110ft – that’s 7,698ft more. I did some rough calculations in my head 7,500 / 3 = 2,500m. 2.5 x 6°C = 15°C drop […]
1372.title: Pikes Peak was rail impossible in the snow

1392.summary: Back in 2015, Jon had an average of a mere 5-Likes per post. On a random November day, eighty-eight more friends took a second glance at this picture and liked it. In his mum’s words, he had “gone viral”. We were in a long-distance relationship at that time – he was based in San Francisco […]
1392.title: My husband was king of the bunnies

1417.summary: The Pikes Peak cog railway adventure was fun despite getting stuck in the snow and not reaching the summit. It was also interesting to learn that we can see Kansas and New Mexico from Pikes Peak, sometimes even Utah and Arizona.  Unca Don and Patsy Rose are like family to me, which makes Colorado my […]
1417.title: What is it like to live around Colorado?
